intro: Dockrillia schoenina, commonly known as the golden dock, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from yellow to red, depending on the species. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
